nl.tudelft.jpacman.board

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.tudelft.jpacman.board.Board

  • public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    A top-down view of a matrix of Squares.

    • Method Detail

      • manhattanDistance

        public static int manhattanDistance(int x0,
                                    int y0,
                                    int x1,
                                    int y1)
        Returns the Manhattan distance between two points p0 and p1 given by their coordinates.
        Parameters:
        x0 - The horizontal coordinate of p0.
        y0 - The vertical coordinate of p0.
        x1 - The horizontal coordinate of p1.
        y1 - The vertical coordinate of p1.
        Returns:
        The int value of the Manhattan distance between the given points.

      • invariant

        public boolean invariant()
        Whatever happens, the squares on the board can't be null.
        Returns:
        false if any square on the board is null.

      • getWidth

        public int getWidth()
        Returns the width of this board, i.e. the amount of columns.
        Returns:
        The width of this board.

      • getHeight

        public int getHeight()
        Returns the height of this board, i.e. the amount of rows.
        Returns:
        The height of this board.

      • squareAt

        public Square squareAt(int x,
                       int y)
        Returns the square at the given x,y position.
        Parameters:
        x - The x position (column) of the requested square.
        y - The y position (row) of the requested square.
        Returns:
        The square at the given x,y position (never null).

      • withinBorders

        public boolean withinBorders(int x,
                             int y)
        Determines whether the given x,y position is on this board.
        Parameters:
        x - The x position (row) to test.
        y - The y position (column) to test.
        Returns:
        true iff the position is on this board.

      • getPossibleSquares

        public java.util.List<Square> getPossibleSquares()
        Retrieves possible target squares for the given player by looking at ghosts positions.
        Returns:
        An ArrayList of Squares the player can move on.
